_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Backes & Toelke Agri Products, Inc.  New Haven, MO Facility Location

Executive Summary



1. Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of BACKES & TOELKE are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Franklin County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.



2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  The anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for that purpose.



3.  Accidental Release Precvention Program.  This facility follows the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration 29 DFR 1910.111 "Storage and Handling of Anhrdrous Ammonia" and Missouri State regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.



4.  Five-Year Accident History.  



5. Emergency Response Program.  The facility has a written Emergency Action Plan.  The company does not plan to have its employees respond to a major release.  If a major release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all other applicable emergency response numbers listed in the Emergency Action Plan.   



6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety is an ongoing process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to access the conditions of the facility. The company plans no major safety changes at this time.
